[LEXICON]: Anachronistic terms ("fax", "automated gate", "solar drone") inappropriate for 18th-century context.

[LOGIC]: Inclusion of modern technological references disrupts historical narrative coherence.

[CLARITY]: Anachronistic elements confuse the historical setting.

[INCONSISTENCY]: Futuristic elements disrupt historical narrative coherence.

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally overly complex sentence structures (e.g., "He was to reel under the first serious blow of his life.")
[LEXICON]: Archaic phrasing ("a-packing," "scandals got abroad") may disrupt modern readability.

[STRUCTURE]: Infrequent long, dense sentences (e.g., final paragraph about 18th-century art).
